Once again, a biased article - it amazes me why the NYT could not publish the truth. The article fails to establish that the riots started because Hindus returning from a pilgrimage to a disputed temple were set on fire by Muslims. The NYT says "the fire started" as if by magic. The article fails to establish that Muslims were killed in retaliation. It starts off saying Muslims were killed in the riots, as if Hindus just acted out of religious hate and without provocation.

It is like saying America has killed thousands of Muslims in Afghanistan since 2001 to 2012, implying religious hate and later describing 9/11 as if the twin towers just happened to crumble.

The reason why riots have not occurred again has everything to do with why the riots began in the first place. Since the riots, Muslims have not indulged in acts of provocation like they did in 2002. What Modi has done is to call the riots for what they are: a response to a provocation. I personally do not believe in an eye for an eye, but it helps me understand why the riots happened in the first place. And it also says the truth about the people of Gujarat, that they are not blindly driven by religious hate.

The impact of such one sided articles is to make Muslims feel like victims and perpetuate the hate that the NYT probably hopes to avoid.
